thread.title: Mum’s horror at discovering a dead MOUSE in her Iceland shopping wedged next to the cheese
thread.title_full: Mum’s horror at discovering a dead MOUSE in her Iceland shopping wedged next to the cheese

author: kcain
title: Mum’s horror at discovering a dead MOUSE in her Iceland shopping wedged next to the cheese
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A MUM is disgusted and claims she’ll never shop at Iceland again after finding a DEAD MOUSE in her home delivery order. 
Hannah Alexander ordered her shopping online from the frozen food chain’s Islington store on Monday night, organising for it to arrive for when she got home from work the following day. Hannah Alexander Hannah Alexander found a dead mouse in her bag of Iceland shopping 
But when the bulk order was delivered, five-year-old son Malachi made the shocking discovery. 
Speaking to The Sun Online, the mum-of-two said: “We’d unpacked most of the bag when my little boy put his hand in and said ‘mum, there’s a mouse in there’. 
“I thought he was joking. 
“It’s surreal. It was wedged between my bananas and cheese. I couldn’t believe there was a mouse in my house.” 
Single-mum Hannah, who also has a 15-year-old daughter Madison, claims that she was in the same north London store eight months ago when she saw another mouse running up and down an aisle and filmed it on her mobile phone. Related stories BOMB UNEARTHED Warning as World War Two German bomb found in Portsmouth Harbour halting ferry and train services TARA DEATH Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's death 'will not be probed at inquest' because she died of natural causes 'IT TOOK MY FILLING OUT' Tourist left with broken tooth after chomping down on glass during £5k dream African holiday that was plagued with constant banging from construction workers AT BRAKING POINT Dramatic moment female cyclist hits back at disgusting catcaller who asked her if she was 'on her period' as she RIPS OFF van's wing mirror BAD APPLE Teacher arrested for 'groping 15-year-old schoolgirl's legs and chest as she leaned forward at his desk' 
When she confronted the store she says they told her they had dealt with it. 
The education consultant from Islington added: “There were still loads of bags all over my floor, waiting to be unpacked, I refused to look I was so worried I’d find another one.” 
Around three hours later Iceland returned to collect the shopping and offered Hannah a refund. 
The mum, who isn’t a regular Iceland shopper, has only occasionally been using the frozen food seller as she was given some vouchers by her employer after shattering her pelvis last September. 
She added: “As a consumer I just feel people need to know about this. My shopping was contaminated so how many other people’s was too? Hannah Alexander 2 She had ordered the food online but when it arrived her son found it wedged in next to the cheese 
“It was quite a long time before they came to pick it up. I kept having visions of the mouse thawing out and running around the room.” 
A spokeswoman for Iceland said: “We take all complaints extremely seriously. We can confirm that Ms Alexander has been in touch with the store regarding a mouse in her home delivery shopping and our Customer Care team is contacting her about this matter. 
“We are conducting a full investigation and have arranged for Ms Alexander to receive a full refund as a gesture of goodwill.”
